t: Proverbs 31
The Words of King Lemuel’s Mother
The*p words of King Lemuel, the utterance which his mother taught him:
What,*pn my son? And*ld what, son of my womb? And*ld what, son of my vows?
Do*ld not give your strength to women, Nor*ld your ways to that which destroys kings.
It*iln is*i not for kings, O Lemuel, It*ild is*i not for kings to drink wine, Nor*ld for princes intoxicating drink;
Lest*ld they drink and forget the law, And*ld pervert the justice of all the afflicted.
Give*ld strong drink to him who is perishing, And*ld wine to those who are bitter of heart.
Let*ld him drink and forget his poverty, And*ld remember his misery no more.
Open*ln your mouth for the speechless, In*ld the cause of all who*i are*i appointed to die.
Open*ld your mouth, judge righteously, And*ld plead the cause of the poor and needy.
The Virtuous Wife
Who*pn can find a virtuous wife? For*ld her worth is*i far above rubies.
The*ld heart of her husband safely trusts her; So*ld he will have no lack of gain.
She*ld does him good and not evil All*ld the days of her life.
She*ld seeks wool and flax, And*ld willingly works with her hands.
She*ld is like the merchant ships, She*ld brings her food from afar.
She*ld also rises while it is yet night, And*ld provides food for her household, And*ld a portion for her maidservants.
She*ld considers a field and buys it; From*ld her profits she plants a vineyard.
She*ld girds herself with strength, And*ld strengthens her arms.
She*ld perceives that her merchandise is*i good, And*ld her lamp does not go out by night.
She*ld stretches out her hands to the distaff, And*ld her hand holds the spindle.
She*ld extends her hand to the poor, Yes,*ld she reaches out her hands to the needy.
She*ld is not afraid of snow for her household, For*ld all her household is*i clothed with scarlet.
She*ld makes tapestry for herself; Her*ld clothing is*i fine linen and purple.
Her*ld husband is known in the gates, When*ld he sits among the elders of the land.
She*ld makes linen garments and sells them,*i And*ld supplies sashes for the merchants.
Strength*ld and honor are*i her clothing; She*ld shall rejoice in time to come.
She*ld opens her mouth with wisdom, And*ld on her tongue is*i the law of kindness.
She*ld watches over the ways of her household, And*ld does not eat the bread of idleness.
Her*ld children rise up and call her blessed; Her*ld husband also,*i and he praises her:
“Many*ld daughters have done well, But*ld you excel them all.”
Charm*ld is*i deceitful and beauty is*i passing, But*ld a woman who*i fears the Lord,*s she shall be praised.
Give*ld her of the fruit of her hands, And*ld let her own works praise her in the gates.
